question: I am technically a type 1.5 Diabetic.  I was diagnosed about 27 years ago as a type 2.  At some point, and it is hard to say when, my Diabetes became Autoimmune (LADA). This was confirmed by a GAD antibody test about 5-7 years ago. As I am totally dependent on Insulin and that has been for about 12-13 years now, I feel more like a type 1. In fact, I have been on a pump  for about 4 years now.  What I was told in my situation I still produce enough Insulin based on the c-peptide test, however, my Diabetes acts more like type 1 because of the autoimmune factor.  I can go from 50 t0 385 in 12 hrs time.  I am seem to have a difficult time getting my Diabetes under control.  My A1C's have been running around 7.5.  However, the last one approached 8.  I have many complications which include, heart failure, coronary artery disease, severe neuropathy, chronic kidney disease, retnopathy, anemia and others. Is there anything that I could do to try and get things more under control?  I do eat too many carbs. Based on my pump, as I am a carb counter, I consume about 325 carbs daily.  I am about 6 feet tall and weigh 240. I am not very active because of my medical conditions.  I have been as low as about 385 on my daily carb consumption and as high as 385. Help!!!!!!!! :)
title: Do you think I am more like a type 1 than 2 and what can I do to be in more control?
